content:
A quick survey: On a multilingual site with several menu items in different languages...

It makes sense that child menu items should have the same language as their parent, in other words, when creating a new menu item in a language, only items of the same language should be available in the parent dropdown list. That seems logic.

But how about language neutral items? Should the parent select list allow all items, regardless of language, or only language neutral ones?

Background to my question is this issue where I'm trying to fix it. :wink:

Menu UI: "Parent link" options only ever shows current language and neutral options · Issue #4857 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the bug When I am adding a menu link for the Spanish language (and url contains langcode=es), I usually want to put the new link underneath another link that is Spanish. The select l...
@mazze.ch What would you expect in that case? All or language neutral only?

A PR is available for testing and feedback is welcome. Especially regarding the node form UX, but any feedback is appreciated. :wink:
